definition: common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)
to discuss matters of vital importance

sentences.english: We would like to cooperate with all of you friends and look forward to developing with your help.
sentences.chinese: 願與社會各界朋友真誠合作，共商發展大計。

sentences.english: He was now in the measures of Lewis XIV.
sentences.chinese: 他此刻正與路易十四共商大計。

sentences.english: We are glad to associate with more foreigners with lofty ideas.
sentences.chinese: 願結交國內外有志之士共商發展大計。

sentences.english: Representatives of different nationalities gather in the same hall to discuss affairs of state.
sentences.chinese: 各族人民的代表聚集一堂，共商國事。

definition: to discuss matters of vital importance
to cooperate on a great undertaking or joint project
to get together all at once
to seek common ground, putting differences aside (idiom)
to be present at a meeting
cross a river in the same boat (idiom); fig. having common interests/obliged to collaborate towards common goals
variant of 擘劃|擘划[bo4 hua4]
